answerText: Shakuntala [or Sakuntala; or The Recognition of Shakuntala; or Abhijnanashakuntalam][10] Kalidasa wrote the play The Recognition of Shakuntala in this classical Indian language, the precursor to Hindi and Bengali. Its foundational grammar was laid out by Panini.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Minnesota A  | 17 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This character is orphaned at a young age and is reared in a sylvan hermitage where her lover comes to hunt at the start of the play she appears in. For 10 points each: [10] Name this maiden who loses a signet ring while crossing a stream and is thus initially unable to present herself to her husband Dushyanta, who was cursed to forget her by the sage Durvasa.
